head.supplied: Melbourne ¶ ¶ bot Garden ¶ 6/9/72 ¶ ¶ Will you be so kind, dear Mr Tulk, to mention to the trustees of the public Library, that I simply carried out a wish of Prof Dr Eichler, presently the Editor ...

div.p: VPRS 5831/PO/4, correspondence inward — miscellaneous letters, p. 189, VA 912 Trustees of the Public Library, Museums and National Gallery of Victoria 1869-1944, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof. p/cs by TD.
Melbourne bot Garden

Will you be so kind, dear Mr Tulk, to mention to the trustees of the public Library, that I simply carried out a wish of Prof Dr Eichler, presently the Editor of the great Work of my late friend Von Martius, when I stated that he could dispose of a complete copy at the price indicated. I will send you the letter (written in German) by Dr Eichler, if you desire it, and am sorry now, that I made the offer on his behalf, as it might appear, as if I had an interest in the matter, or as if I wished to force a costly copy on the Library.

I shall on no future occasion make myself the medium of any similar communications. That occasionally a copy (perhaps damaged or perhaps in complete) of a work is offered at far less than its real value is well known to you. I have paid my London or Hamburg or any other bookseller often double and triple the price for a work, which soon subsequently was advertised in an antiquarian catalogue surprisingly cheap.
